column4: the liveCD (from dapper on) has an install option, it's an icon on the desktop
Can't find a LiveCD link on the site. Are they not distributing a LiveCD apart from the regular installation anymore?
the liveCD is now the 'desktop' CD, and the old textmode installer is now the 'Alternate' CD
Would I not be able to get the files off the drive using a server installation CD?
what? which files? what are you doing?
Trying to get my data off the drive before I install. I was planning on installing from a server CD.
ah, I see.  No, the server CD (besides installing a GUILess box, are you sure you want that? and not the alternate CD?) won't allow you to do anything except install (it's not a liveCD)
Depends... what exactly IS the alternate CD?
I was mostly after a bare-bones installation. I was going to install packages piecemeal after that to get what I want. The default installation comes with a lot more than I really need.
you're better off using the Alternate CD, and using the 'server' install option on that, than the server CD, if bandwidth isn't an issue
What's the difference?
however, neither the alternate, nor the server CDs will allow you read/copy stuff from your current drive
well, the serverCD installs optimized kernels for server environments, which you'll have to switch to use as a desktop (or performance suffers)
Whereas the alternate CD doesn't do that?
So the alternate CD with the server option doesn't include those server-specific enhancements?
right, it'll install the normal desktop kernel,  of course it is also 700mb instead of 400, because it also has the entire ubuntu-desktop
Is that all it has, as far as supplements to the bare-bones install?

what?  Alternate does have some additional packages on it, ubuntu + more stuff, if you didn't have a desktop.  You might however be interested in grabbing the xubuntu alternate CD, if xubuntu is lightweight enough for you
the xubuntu alternate will also install the (flavor independant) basic, GUIless, server install too.
I was hoping for either GUIless or GUI only and to be able to manually install packages from there.
right, any install disk will get you that.  I personally prefer the alternate CD, with the server install option, which is just plain vanilla ubuntu, without any GUI.
Cool. Thank you very much for the advice. :)
